fields.name: token
fields.description: Unique, cryptographically secure token by which this card can be identified in the future. This value should be kept secure in your system's as payment authorizations are created against this token.

fields.description: The issuer identification number (IIN) (formerly known as the Bank Identification Number) which are the leading digits of the card number.

fields.description: Cleartext last 4 numbers of the card

fields.description: Cardholder name

fields.name: address
fields.description: Cardholder billing address

allModels.description: Card represents the metadata about a secure, tokenized card. The card 'token' is a unique, cryptographically secure token by which this card can be identified in the future. The card token itself will either be a permanent card token (denoted by a prefix of F96) or a one time nonce (denoted by a prefix of F17). Nonces represent cards that were encrypted from public channels (like the user's browser via JavaScript) and can be used once only. If you have a nonce you can exchange it for a permanent card token via the operation POST /:organization/cards/nonces

fields.name: number
fields.description: Cleartext card number. You must provide either this field or 'cipher', but not both. May contain integers only or integers with dashes. If dashes are provided, we will remove them, storing only the raw number.

fields.name: cipher
fields.description: Card number encrypted using your assigned public key. You must provide either this field or 'number', but not both. Card number itself may contain integers only or integers with dashes. If dashes are provided, we will remove them, storing only the raw number.

fields.description: The month of expiration expressed as a number. 1 = January, 12 = December

fields.name: challenge_text
fields.description: When providing a cipher, you can optionally provide a challenge text and challenge cipher that will allow us to verify that client side encryption worked properly, returning better error messages in some cases. The Flow JavaScript API uses the challenge to verify that the asymmetric encryption is working properly in the client.

fields.name: challenge_cipher
fields.description: When providing a cipher, you can optionally provide a challenge text and challenge cipher that will allow us to verify that client side encryption worked properly, returning better error messages in some cases. The Flow JavaScript API uses the challenge to verify that the asymmetric encryption is working properly in the client.

fields.description: Determines whether or not you want to create a permanent, tokenized card or a one time use token. By default, authenticated API requests create permanent tokens. allEnums.name: merchant_of_record
allEnums.description: The merchant of record enum defines who is merchant of record for a particular transaction - either Flow is serving as the merchant of record or the organization is serving as merchant of record.

allEnums.name: order_merchant_of_record
allEnums.description: The order merchant of record defines who is merchant of record for a particular order. The value will be 'mixed' if you support split payments and the merchant of record differed across the individual payment transactions.

allEnums.name: rounding_method

values.name: up
values.description: Round up to the specified rounding.value

values.name: down
values.description: Round down to the specified rounding.value

values.name: nearest
values.description: Round to the nearest specified rounding.value. If equidistant, will round up.

allEnums.description: Direction to round localized price

allEnums.name: rounding_type

values.name: pattern
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount ending with a pattern, e.g. an amount ending in '.99'.

values.name: multiple
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount that is the multiple of a value, e.g. rounding to the nearest 5 would ensure that the resulting number ends in either 0 or 5.

allEnums.description: Rounding type determines the rule used to enforce rounding. Common rules will ensure that the final price ends w/ a given number (e.g. ends with .95) or is a multiple of some number (multiples of 5 or 10 are common).

allEnums.name: authorization_option

values.name: store_card
values.description: If set, and the authorization is created using a one time nonce, we automatically tokenize and store the card. In these cases you will want to store the new card token in the authorization response (card object)

allEnums.description: Specifies optional behaviors that can be applied during an authorization

allEnums.name: authorization_result_action_type

values.name: redirect
values.description: Indicates that the user should be redirected to the provided URL.

values.name: wait
values.description: Indicates that more time is needed before the authorization result is known. In the case of 3D Secure, this means the authorization status should be polled until it is no longer pending.

allEnums.description: Specifies an action necessary to continue processing the authorization, such as redirecting to a payment issuer to complete user verification.

values.name: pending
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'pending'. For example, online payment methods like AliPay or PayPal will have a status of 'pending' until the user completes the payment. Pending authorizations expire if the user does not complete the payment in a timely fashion.

values.name: expired
values.description: Authorization has expired.

values.name: authorized
values.description: Authorization was successful

values.name: review
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'review' - this usually indicates fraud review requires additional time / verification (or a potential network issue with the issuing bank)

values.name: declined
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been declined by the issuing bank. See the authorization decline code for more details as to the reason for decline.

values.name: reversed
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been fully reversed. You can fully reverse an authorization up until the moment you capture funds; once you have captured funds you must create refunds.

values.name: match
values.description: Full match

values.name: partial
values.description: Partial match; see details in 'avs' model to understand which components matched

values.name: unsupported
values.description: Issuer does not support address verification

values.name: no_match
values.description: Address does not match expected card values

values.name: insufficient_funds

values.name: unknown

allEnums.name: refund_decline_code

values.name: expired
values.description: All associated payment captures have expired; refunds can no longer be issued

values.name: insufficient_funds
values.description: The requested refund amount exceeded the amount of remaining unrefunded funds

values.name: unknown
values.description: Failed due to another reason (details not known)

allEnums.description: Contains details related to the reason for which a refund failed.

values.name: pending
values.description: The refund has been initiated and requires time to complete.

values.name: succeeded
values.description: The refund has been processed successfully.

values.name: failed
values.description: The refund failed to process.

values.name: canceled
values.description: The refund was canceled.

values.name: amount_exceeds_balance
values.description: Amount specified exceeds the remaining authorization balance.

values.name: authorization_declined
values.description: The authorization was initially declined; there is nothing to reverse.

values.name: authorization_expired
values.description: The authorization has expired and can no longer be reversed.

values.name: invalid_authorization
values.description: The authorization was not found.

values.name: invalid_key
values.description: Invalid key

values.name: invalid_amount
values.description: Amount is not valid - usually because amount was <= 0

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Currency is either not known or invalid

values.name: no_remaining_balance
values.description: The authorization has already been fully captured and/or reversed - there are no additional funds to reverse.

values.name: partial_reversal_not_supported
values.description: Indicates a request for a partial reversal when the underlying processor does not support it

values.name: unknown
values.description: Unknown or other

values.name: pending
values.description: Reversal is pending processing.

values.name: processed
values.description: Reversal has been processed successfully.

values.name: failed
values.description: Reversal failed to process.

values.name: permanent
values.description: Create a permanent token for the card (stored up until normal purge interval)

values.name: one_time
values.description: Create a one time token for the card. This token can be used to either authorized payment or later exchange for a permanent token. Once used, this token cannot be used for future activity.

values.name: generic_error
values.description: Generic errors are the default type. The accompanying message will provide details on the failure.

values.name: client_error
values.description: A client error has occurred. This represents a misconfiguration of the client

values.name: server_error
values.description: A server error has occurred. The Flow tech team is automatically notified of all server errors

fields.description: Reference to region as defined in https://api.flow.io/reference/regions

fields.description: When otherwise not known, the default country to use for this experience. One example would be an experience setup for Europe - when you request landed cost, if there is no geolocation information available, we will use this country as the basis for landed cost. ISO 3166 3 currency code as defined in https://api.flow.io/reference/countries

fields.description: This currency defines the base currency for all pricing related features - e.g. pricing functions. ISO 4217 3 currency code as defined in https://api.flow.io/reference/currencies

fields.description: The default language to use for when displaying products, e.g. to display product information in this language by default. ISO 639 2 language code as defined in https://api.flow.io/reference/languages

fields.name: position
fields.description: Position of this experience relative to other experiences. Lower position indicates experience should be considered first. Main use is to resolve incoming geolocation data (e.g. ip, country) to pick an experience. We do this by walking through the list of experiences to find the first one that matches the user's geography.

The shipping price is then based on these selections (and included in the prices array). You can update an order before it has been submitted to change the delivery options, getting back accurate pricing for the order.

Each payment will be typed - supporting options like a $25 account credit applied to an order plus a balance paid by a card, paypal, cash on delivery, etc. The list of payments here is summary information only for display back to the user; each individual payment will have varying levels of detail based on the actual type of the payment

allModels.description: An order represents all of the information about a particular set of line items, including pricing, currency rates, delivery options, etc. All information in an order is guaranteed by Flow - if an order is submitted before its expiration. The intended use case is to create an order as a consumer enters checkout, then to submit that order as part of the user submitting their order. Note that Flow will automatically mark an order submitted if we see payment authorization(s) covering the full balance of an order.

fields.name: total

fields.name: adjustment
fields.description: The total amount the total price was altered due to sales margins. A negative value indicates a discount.

allModels.description: Card represents the metadata about a secure, tokenized card. The card 'token' is a unique, cryptographically secure token by which this card can be identified in the future. The card token itself will either be a permanent card token (denoted by a prefix of F96) or a one time nonce (denoted by a prefix of F17). Nonces represent cards that were encrypted from public channels (like the user's browser via JavaScript) and can be used once only. If you have a nonce you can exchange it for a permanent card token via the operation POST /:organization/cards/nonces

Items affected with rules pursuing an unlimited strategy will always be available

values.name: invalid_order_number

values.name: amount_must_be_positive
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount was <= 0

values.name: amount_exceeds_balance
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the remaining balance on the order

values.name: insufficient_amount
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the maximum amount of applicable credit

values.name: all
values.description: Displays all available options to the customer.

values.name: single
values.description: Displays a single option (either DDU or DDP), while the other can be displayed by changing duties and tax preferences at checkout.

values.name: display
values.description: A displayed payment method will be highlighted during the checkout process for an experience.

values.name: archiving
values.description: Archiving indicates an experience has been archived. We allow some time for sessions to expire before fully marking the experience archived.

values.name: invalid_authorization
values.description: Indicates the specified authorization key does not exist

values.name: invalid_authorization_amount
values.description: Indicates the specified authorization amount does not match the first installment in the plan

values.name: invalid_installment_plan
values.description: Indicates the specified installment plan does not exist

values.name: order_item_not_available
values.description: When creating an order, if a particular item is not available in the country / destination (either because it was restricted or excluded from that country), we return this error code and list the specific item numbers which are not available in the 'numbers' field.

values.name: order_identifier_error
values.description: Indicates that there is no order with the specified number (nor an order for which an order identifier with that number has been created)

values.name: authorization_invalid
values.description: The authorization key specified is invalid - either because it does not exist or is not associated with this order

values.name: domestic_shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country for one of your domicile countries and you have asked Flow not to accept orders for this country.

values.name: shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country to which you have asked Flow not to ship.

values.name: value_threshold_exceeded
values.description: Indicates the order value exceeds the value threshold for destination and cannot be shipped. When specified, the order will also populate the threshold attribute.

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Indicates that the specified currency code is not valid

values.name: invalid_country
values.description: Indicates that the specified country code is not valid

values.name: invalid_region
values.description: Indicates that the specified region code is not valid

values.name: invalid_language

allEnums.name: order_payment_type

values.name: card
values.description: Represents a payment in the form of a credit or debit card

values.name: online
values.description: Represents an online payment (e.g. paypal, alipay, etc)

values.name: credit
values.description: A payment in the form of a credit of some type (e.g. a store credit, gift card) applied to an order

values.name: installment_plan
values.description: An installment plan payment represents that the user has elected an installment plan to pay for this order. For the purposes of the order, the balance will reflect fully paid for the total value of the installment plan, even though individual installments may be created in the future.

values.name: cash_on_delivery
values.description: Request to pay the balance with cash on delivery. Offered only when the final mile carriers support cash on delivery.

allEnums.description: The order payment type identified the different ways a consumer may have paid for an order. The primary purpose is in displaying summary level payment information to the user; the type can then be used to know how to request additional details for each payment.

values.name: adjustment

values.name: vat_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment based on whether the VAT de minimis applies to the order.

values.name: duty_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment based on whether the duty de minimis applies to the order.

values.name: duties_item_price

values.name: duties_freight
values.description: The duty owed on the freight cost of the order.

values.name: duties_insurance
values.description: The duty owed on the insurance cost of the order.

values.name: vat_item_price
values.description: The VAT owed on the price of the order's items, including any added margins and rounding.

values.name: vat_freight
values.description: The VAT owed on the freight cost of the order.

values.description: The VAT owed on the insurance cost of the order.

values.description: The VAT owed on the duties on the price of the order's items, including any added margins and rounding.

values.name: vat_duties_freight

values.name: vat_duties_insurance
values.description: The VAT owed on the duties on the insurance cost of the order.

values.description: The sum of any rounding applied to the order's items.

values.name: insurance
values.description: The insurance cost for the order.

values.name: shipping
values.description: The shipping cost for the order.

values.name: order_discount
values.description: A discount applied to the entire order.

values.description: The sum of adjustments to item price, margin and rounding made due to percentage sales margins.

values.description: The sum of adjustments to VAT owed made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: subtotal_duty_percent_sales_margin
values.description: The sum of adjustments to duty owed made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: vat_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any VAT subsidized by the organization. For example, if VAT is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific VAT rate), the difference will be represented here.

values.name: duty_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any duty subsidized by the organization. For example, if duty is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific duty rate), the difference will be represented here.

values.name: remote_area_surcharge
values.description: Surcharge applied to a shipment for delivery to a remote area determined by the carrier.

values.name: fuel_surcharge
values.description: Surcharge applied to a shipment for fuel consumption by the carrier.

values.description: The details of any adjustments made to the order.

values.name: duty

values.name: shipping

values.name: insurance

values.name: discount
values.description: The details of any discount applied to the order.

values.name: surcharges

allEnums.name: margin_type

values.name: fixed
values.description: A fixed amount to add, e.g 2.5 would add an absolute margin of 2.5 in the base currency of your item.

values.description: A percent of the base cost to add, e.g. 1.2 would represent a 1.2% increase.

allEnums.description: Either a fixed or percent adjustment applied to some amount.

allEnums.name: merchant_of_record
allEnums.description: The merchant of record enum defines who is merchant of record for a particular transaction - either Flow is serving as the merchant of record or the organization is serving as merchant of record.

allEnums.name: order_merchant_of_record
allEnums.description: The order merchant of record defines who is merchant of record for a particular order. The value will be 'mixed' if you support split payments and the merchant of record differed across the individual payment transactions.

values.description: Round to the nearest specified rounding.value. If equidistant, will round up.

allEnums.name: rounding_type

values.name: pattern
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount ending with a pattern, e.g. an amount ending in '.99'.

values.name: multiple
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount that is the multiple of a value, e.g. rounding to the nearest 5 would ensure that the resulting number ends in either 0 or 5.

allEnums.description: Rounding type determines the rule used to enforce rounding. Common rules will ensure that the final price ends w/ a given number (e.g. ends with .95) or is a multiple of some number (multiples of 5 or 10 are common).

allEnums.name: authorization_option

values.name: store_card
values.description: If set, and the authorization is created using a one time nonce, we automatically tokenize and store the card. In these cases you will want to store the new card token in the authorization response (card object)

allEnums.description: Specifies optional behaviors that can be applied during an authorization

allEnums.name: authorization_result_action_type

values.name: redirect
values.description: Indicates that the user should be redirected to the provided URL.

values.name: wait
values.description: Indicates that more time is needed before the authorization result is known. In the case of 3D Secure, this means the authorization status should be polled until it is no longer pending.

allEnums.description: Specifies an action necessary to continue processing the authorization, such as redirecting to a payment issuer to complete user verification.

values.name: pending
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'pending'. For example, online payment methods like AliPay or PayPal will have a status of 'pending' until the user completes the payment. Pending authorizations expire if the user does not complete the payment in a timely fashion.

values.name: expired
values.description: Authorization has expired.

values.name: authorized
values.description: Authorization was successful

values.name: review
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'review' - this usually indicates fraud review requires additional time / verification (or a potential network issue with the issuing bank)

values.name: declined
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been declined by the issuing bank. See the authorization decline code for more details as to the reason for decline.

values.name: reversed
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been fully reversed. You can fully reverse an authorization up until the moment you capture funds; once you have captured funds you must create refunds.

values.name: match
values.description: Full match

values.name: partial
values.description: Partial match; see details in 'avs' model to understand which components matched

values.name: unsupported
values.description: Issuer does not support address verification

values.name: no_match
values.description: Address does not match expected card values

values.name: invalid_currency

fields.name: region
fields.description: Reference to region as defined in https://api.flow.io/reference/regions

fields.name: country
fields.description: When otherwise not known, the default country to use for this experience. One example would be an experience setup for Europe - when you request landed cost, if there is no geolocation information available, we will use this country as the basis for landed cost. ISO 3166 3 currency code as defined in https://api.flow.io/reference/countries

fields.name: currency
fields.description: This currency defines the base currency for all pricing related features - e.g. pricing functions. ISO 4217 3 currency code as defined in https://api.flow.io/reference/currencies

fields.name: language
fields.description: The default language to use for when displaying products, e.g. to display product information in this language by default. ISO 639 2 language code as defined in https://api.flow.io/reference/languages

fields.name: position
fields.description: Position of this experience relative to other experiences. Lower position indicates experience should be considered first. Main use is to resolve incoming geolocation data (e.g. ip, country) to pick an experience. We do this by walking through the list of experiences to find the first one that matches the user's geography.

allModels.name: order

fields.name: merchant_of_record
fields.description: Once an order is fully paid, we record who the merchant of record for this order is.

fields.name: experience
fields.description: Contains information on the experience on which this order was submitted.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The customer who is actually making the purchase

fields.name: delivered_duty
fields.description: Options returned will only use tiers with the matching delivered duty. This would also affect whether duties are included in the total or not. If not specified, defaults based on the experience default setting.

fields.name: expires_at
fields.description: The date and time on which this order will expire unless submitted. Used only when the order status is 'open'. New orders will expire 1 hour after creation.

fields.name: selections
fields.description: The currently selected delivery option ids. These IDs represent the shipping tiers that the customer has chosen (e.g. standard or express) for each delivery. The shipping price is then based on these selections (and included in the prices array). You can update an order before it has been submitted to change the delivery options, getting back accurate pricing for the order.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to the order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the charge in a structured format.

fields.description: The timestamp on which the order is submitted. Once submitted, production orders can no longer be deleted as they represent transactions in the real world

fields.name: identifiers
fields.description: Other identifiers which are used to identify this order, if available.

fields.name: promotions
fields.description: The current available and applied promotions for this order

fields.name: payments
fields.description: Represents the list of payments on an order. Each payment will be typed - supporting options like a $25 account credit applied to an order plus a balance paid by a card, paypal, cash on delivery, etc. The list of payments here is summary information only for display back to the user; each individual payment will have varying levels of detail based on the actual type of the payment

fields.name: balance
fields.description: The remaining balance on this order. Will be marked required in a future version of the Flow API

fields.name: rules
fields.description: Represents a summary of the rules related to this order.

fields.name: tax_registration
fields.description: Represents the tax registration on an order, if applicable.

allModels.description: An order represents all of the information about a particular set of line items, including pricing, currency rates, delivery options, etc. All information in an order is guaranteed by Flow - if an order is submitted before its expiration. The intended use case is to create an order as a consumer enters checkout, then to submit that order as part of the user submitting their order. Note that Flow will automatically mark an order submitted if we see payment authorization(s) covering the full balance of an order.

Each delivery will contain one or more shipping options (e.g. standard or express). We need to know which shipping options the user selected in order to provide accurate, local shipping pricing. You should only specify if you are explicitly changing the delivery options

allModels.description: Card represents the metadata about a secure, tokenized card. The card 'token' is a unique, cryptographically secure token by which this card can be identified in the future. The card token itself will either be a permanent card token (denoted by a prefix of F96) or a one time nonce (denoted by a prefix of F17). Nonces represent cards that were encrypted from public channels (like the user's browser via JavaScript) and can be used once only. If you have a nonce you can exchange it for a permanent card token via the operation POST /:organization/cards/nonces

The Flow JavaScript API uses the challenge to verify that the asymmetric encryption is working properly in the client.

fields.name: challenge_cipher
fields.description: When providing a cipher, you can optionally provide a challenge text and challenge cipher that will allow us to verify that client side encryption worked properly, returning better error messages in some cases. The Flow JavaScript API uses the challenge to verify that the asymmetric encryption is working properly in the client.

allUnions.name: inventory_strategy

types.description: Enables backorders, setting an optional number of units that we allow for backorder. For example, a backorder w/ quantity 10 will enable selling until the actual inventory quantity is -10.

Treats inventory as available as long as the actual inventory quantity is > the specified quantity. A common use case is to set quantity to zero to indicate availability as long as there is at least 1 unit available.
Items affected with rules pursuing an unlimited strategy will always be available

values.name: invalid_order_number
values.description: Indicates the specified order does not exist

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Indicates that the specified currency code is not valid

values.name: invalid_description
values.description: Indicates that the description is invalid (must be non-empty)

values.name: duplicate
values.description: Indicates that a credit payment with the specified key already exists

values.name: amount_must_be_positive
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount was <= 0

values.name: amount_exceeds_balance
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the remaining balance on the order

values.name: insufficient_amount
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the maximum amount of applicable credit

values.name: all
values.description: Displays all available options to the customer.

values.name: single
values.description: Displays a single option (either DDU or DDP), while the other can be displayed by changing duties and tax preferences at checkout.

values.name: display
values.description: A displayed payment method will be highlighted during the checkout process for an experience.

values.name: archiving
values.description: Archiving indicates an experience has been archived. We allow some time for sessions to expire before fully marking the experience archived.

values.name: invalid_authorization
values.description: Indicates the specified authorization key does not exist

values.name: invalid_authorization_amount
values.description: Indicates the specified authorization amount does not match the first installment in the plan

values.name: invalid_installment_plan
values.description: Indicates the specified installment plan does not exist

values.name: order_item_not_available
values.description: When creating an order, if a particular item is not available in the country / destination (either because it was restricted or excluded from that country), we return this error code and list the specific item numbers which are not available in the 'numbers' field.

values.name: order_identifier_error
values.description: Indicates that there is no order with the specified number (nor an order for which an order identifier with that number has been created)

values.name: authorization_invalid
values.description: The authorization key specified is invalid - either because it does not exist or is not associated with this order

values.name: domestic_shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country for one of your domicile countries and you have asked Flow not to accept orders for this country.

values.name: shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country to which you have asked Flow not to ship.

values.name: value_threshold_exceeded
values.description: Indicates the order value exceeds the value threshold for destination and cannot be shipped. When specified, the order will also populate the threshold attribute.

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Indicates that the specified currency code is not valid

values.name: invalid_country
values.description: Indicates that the specified country code is not valid

values.name: invalid_region
values.description: Indicates that the specified region code is not valid

values.name: invalid_language
values.description: Indicates that the specified language code is not valid

allEnums.name: order_payment_type

values.name: card
values.description: Represents a payment in the form of a credit or debit card

values.name: online
values.description: Represents an online payment (e.g. paypal, alipay, etc)

values.name: credit
values.description: A payment in the form of a credit of some type (e.g. a store credit, gift card) applied to an order

values.name: installment_plan
values.description: An installment plan payment represents that the user has elected an installment plan to pay for this order. For the purposes of the order, the balance will reflect fully paid for the total value of the installment plan, even though individual installments may be created in the future.

values.name: cash_on_delivery
values.description: Request to pay the balance with cash on delivery. Offered only when the final mile carriers support cash on delivery.

allEnums.description: The order payment type identified the different ways a consumer may have paid for an order. The primary purpose is in displaying summary level payment information to the user; the type can then be used to know how to request additional details for each payment.

values.name: adjustment
values.description: A general purpose adjustment applied to the order.

values.name: vat_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment based on whether the VAT de minimis applies to the order.

values.name: duty_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment based on whether the duty de minimis applies to the order.

values.name: vat_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any VAT subsidized by the organization. For example, if VAT is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific VAT rate), the difference will be represented here.

values.name: duty_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any duty subsidized by the organization. For example, if duty is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific duty rate), the difference will be represented here.

values.name: down

allEnums.name: rounding_type

values.name: pattern
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount ending with a pattern, e.g. an amount ending in '.99'.

values.name: multiple
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount that is the multiple of a value, e.g. rounding to the nearest 5 would ensure that the resulting number ends in either 0 or 5.

allEnums.description: Rounding type determines the rule used to enforce rounding. Common rules will ensure that the final price ends w/ a given number (e.g. ends with .95) or is a multiple of some number (multiples of 5 or 10 are common).

allEnums.name: simple_rounding_strategy

values.description: Intermediate values are not modified.

values.description: Intermediate values are rounding to the given currency's precision using HALF_UP rounding. For example, $12.344 USD is rounded to $12.34, while $12.345 USD is rounded to $12.35.

allEnums.description: Represents a rounding strategy for calculating prices in a given currency when the fractional part of an intermediate value has precision greater than the number of decimals used by that currency.

values.description: Payment method has expired

values.description: Invalid card holder name

values.name: invalid_expiration

values.description: Invalid billing address

values.description: Cannot create a permanent card via an unauthorized request

values.name: invalid_token
values.description: The provided card token is invalid or it does not exist.

values.description: The provided payment method is not known by the issuing bank (the account does not exist)

values.name: avs
values.description: Declined due to avs mismatch)

values.name: cvv
values.description: Declined due to cvv mismatch)

values.description: Declined due to suspected fraud

values.name: duplicate
values.description: Declined due to suspected duplicate transaction

allEnums.name: authorization_option

values.name: store_card
values.description: If set, and the authorization is created using a one time nonce, we automatically tokenize and store the card. In these cases you will want to store the new card token in the authorization response (card object)

allEnums.description: Specifies optional behaviors that can be applied during an authorization

allEnums.name: authorization_result_action_type

values.name: redirect
values.description: Indicates that the user should be redirected to the provided URL.

values.name: wait
values.description: Indicates that more time is needed before the authorization result is known. In the case of 3D Secure, this means the authorization status should be polled until it is no longer pending.

allEnums.description: Specifies an action necessary to continue processing the authorization, such as redirecting to a payment issuer to complete user verification.

values.name: pending
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'pending'. For example, online payment methods like AliPay or PayPal will have a status of 'pending' until the user completes the payment. Pending authorizations expire if the user does not complete the payment in a timely fashion.

values.name: expired
values.description: Authorization has expired.

values.name: authorized
values.description: Authorization was successful

values.name: review
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'review' - this usually indicates fraud review requires additional time / verification (or a potential network issue with the issuing bank)

values.name: declined
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been declined by the issuing bank. See the authorization decline code for more details as to the reason for decline.

values.name: reversed
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been fully reversed. You can fully reverse an authorization up until the moment you capture funds; once you have captured funds you must create refunds.

values.name: match
values.description: Full match

values.name: partial
values.description: Partial match; see details in 'avs' model to understand which components matched

values.name: unsupported
values.description: Issuer does not support address verification

values.name: no_match
values.description: Address does not match expected card values

values.description: Payment authorization has expired

values.name: insufficient_funds
values.description: The amount to capture exceeded the amount authorized and not yet captured

values.name: unknown
values.description: Failed due to another reason (details not known)

allEnums.description: Contains details related to the reason for which a capture failed.

values.name: pending
values.description: The capture has been initiated and requires time to complete.

values.name: succeeded
values.description: The capture has been processed successfully.

values.name: failed

fields.name: experience
fields.description: Contains information on the experience on which this order was submitted.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The customer who is actually making the purchase

fields.name: delivered_duty
fields.description: Options returned will only use tiers with the matching delivered duty. This would also affect whether duties are included in the total or not. If not specified, defaults based on the experience default setting.

fields.name: expires_at
fields.description: The date and time on which this order will expire unless submitted. Used only when the order status is 'open'. New orders will expire 1 hour after creation.

fields.name: selections
fields.description: The currently selected delivery option ids. These IDs represent the shipping tiers that the customer has chosen (e.g. standard or express) for each delivery. The shipping price is then based on these selections (and included in the prices array). You can update an order before it has been submitted to change the delivery options, getting back accurate pricing for the order.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to the order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the charge in a structured format.

fields.name: submitted_at
fields.description: The timestamp on which the order is submitted. Once submitted, production orders can no longer be deleted as they represent transactions in the real world

fields.name: lines
fields.description: Provides display data for each of the line items belonging to this order.

fields.name: identifiers
fields.description: Other identifiers which are used to identify this order, if available.

fields.name: promotions
fields.description: The current available and applied promotions for this order

fields.name: payments
fields.description: Represents the list of payments on an order. Each payment will be typed - supporting options like a $25 account credit applied to an order plus a balance paid by a card, paypal, cash on delivery, etc. The list of payments here is summary information only for display back to the user; each individual payment will have varying levels of detail based on the actual type of the payment

fields.name: balance
fields.description: The remaining balance on this order. Will be marked required in a future version of the Flow API

fields.name: rules
fields.description: Represents a summary of the rules related to this order.

fields.name: tax_registration
fields.description: Represents the tax registration on an order, if applicable.

allModels.description: An order represents all of the information about a particular set of line items, including pricing, currency rates, delivery options, etc. All information in an order is guaranteed by Flow - if an order is submitted before its expiration. The intended use case is to create an order as a consumer enters checkout, then to submit that order as part of the user submitting their order. Note that Flow will automatically mark an order submitted if we see payment authorization(s) covering the full balance of an order.

fields.description: Contact information of entity at the address

allModels.description: Card represents the metadata about a secure, tokenized card. The card 'token' is a unique, cryptographically secure token by which this card can be identified in the future. The card token itself will either be a permanent card token (denoted by a prefix of F96) or a one time nonce (denoted by a prefix of F17). Nonces represent cards that were encrypted from public channels (like the user's browser via JavaScript) and can be used once only. If you have a nonce you can exchange it for a permanent card token via the operation POST /:organization/cards/nonces

fields.name: number
fields.description: Cleartext card number. You must provide either this field or 'cipher', but not both. May contain integers only or integers with dashes. If dashes are provided, we will remove them, storing only the raw number.

fields.name: cipher
fields.description: Card number encrypted using your assigned public key. You must provide either this field or 'number', but not both. Card number itself may contain integers only or integers with dashes. If dashes are provided, we will remove them, storing only the raw number.

fields.name: challenge_text
fields.description: When providing a cipher, you can optionally provide a challenge text and challenge cipher that will allow us to verify that client side encryption worked properly, returning better error messages in some cases. The Flow JavaScript API uses the challenge to verify that the asymmetric encryption is working properly in the client.

fields.name: challenge_cipher
fields.description: When providing a cipher, you can optionally provide a challenge text and challenge cipher that will allow us to verify that client side encryption worked properly, returning better error messages in some cases. The Flow JavaScript API uses the challenge to verify that the asymmetric encryption is working properly in the client.

fields.name: token_type
fields.description: Determines whether or not you want to create a permanent, tokenized card or a one time use token. By default, authenticated API requests create permanent tokens. fields.name: authorization_id
fields.description: The Id of the authorization against which to issue the refund. If specified, we will look at all captures for this authorization, selecting 1 or more captures against which to issue the refund of the requested amount.

fields.name: capture_id
fields.description: The Id of the capture against which to issue the refund. If specified, we will only consider this capture.

fields.name: order_number
fields.description: The order number if specified during authorization. If specified, we will lookup all authorizations made against this order number, and then selecting 1 or more authorizations against which to issue the refund of the requested amount.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Your unique identifier for this transaction, which if provided is used to implement idempotency. If not provided, we will assign.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount to refund, in the currency of the associated capture. Defaults to the value of the capture minus any prior refunds.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The ISO 4217-3 code for the currency. Required if amount is specified. Case insensitive. Note you will get an error if the currency does not match the related authorization's currency. See https://api.flow.io/reference/currencies

fields.name: rma_key
fields.description: The RMA key, if available. If specified, this will update the RMA status as refunded.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a refund object

allModels.description: Refund actually transfers funds. You can refund as many times as you'd like up until the total amount of captured funds has been refunded. Note when creating a refund you can specify either an order authorization id, a capture id, or an order number (or all of them as long as they match).

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The ISO 4217-3 code for the currency. Case insensitive. See https://api.flow.io/reference/currencies

fields.description: The total amount of funds captured for this order. If there were multiple captures, this number will include the sum of the amounts captured.

fields.name: refunded

fields.name: balance
fields.description: The total amount of funds available to refund (sum of all captures minus all prior refunds).

fields.name: balance_excluding_shipping
fields.description: The balance minus shipping costs. If there was either no shipping cost or the remaining balance is less than the shipping cost, this field will not be provided.

fields.name: shipping
fields.description: The total amount of shipping on the order, if there was a shipping fee. We highlight this value separately to simplify use cases where a full refund minus shipping is used.

allModels.description: Detailed examples of amount to refund following common e-commerce use cases.

fields.name: value
fields.description: String - at flow, we serialize a `localized_variant` json object here.

allModels.name: price_rule

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique numeric identifier for the discount.

fields.name: value_type
fields.description: The value type of the price rule, which can either be a fixed amount or a percentage. If `target_type` is 'shipping_line', then only 'percentage' is accepted. (Also - that percentage can only be 100%).

fields.name: target_type
fields.description: Specifies the resource to which the price rule is applied, which will either be a line item or a shipping line.

fields.name: value
fields.description: If target type is 'shipping line', then only a value of -100 is accepted. Values must start with a negative sign (-).

fields.name: starts_at
fields.description: The date when the discount code becomes valid for use during checkout.

fields.name: ends_at
fields.description: The date when the discount code becomes disabled.

fields.name: prerequisite_subtotal_range
fields.description: Prerequisite cart subtotal range.

fields.name: prerequisite_shipping_range
fields.description: Prerequisite shipping cost range. Can only be used when target type is 'shipping_line'. For example, one use case would be to offer free shipping if it's less than or equal to some value.

fields.name: usage_limit
fields.description: The maximum number of times the price rule can be used per discount code. Leave blank for unlimited uses.

fields.name: entitled_product_ids
fields.description: An array of all applicable product ids to which the price rule applies. In order to have entitled products, `target_selection` must be 'selected'.

fields.name: entitled_variant_ids
fields.description: An array of all applicable product variant ids to which the price rule applies. In order to have entitled products, `target_selection` must be 'selected'.

fields.name: entitled_collection_ids
fields.description: An array of all applicable collection ids to which the price rule applies. In order to have entitled products, `target_selection` must be 'selected'.

fields.name: entitled_country_ids
fields.description: An array of all applicable country ids to which the price rule applies. In order to have entitled products, `target_selection` must be 'selected'. It is important to note that the id for a given country in one shop will not be the same as the id for the same country in another shop.

fields.name: allocation_method
fields.description: The allocation method of the price rule. With an allocation method of 'each', the discount will be applied to each of the entitled items. With an allocation method of 'across', the calculated discount amount will be applied across the entitled items.

fields.name: once_per_customer
fields.description: Determines whether the price rule can be used only once per customer (by customer id).

fields.name: target_selection
fields.description: The target selection method of the rule, which is either 'all' or 'entitled'.

fields.name: customer_selection
fields.description: The customer selection method of the price rule, which is either 'all' or 'selected'.

fields.name: prerequisite_saved_search_ids
fields.description: A list of prerequisite customer saved search ids. For the price rule to apply, the customer applying the price rule must be in the group of customers matching the customer saved searches. Requires `customer_selection` to be 'selected'.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the price rule, which may differ from its associated discount code(s), although it is recommended to be the same.

allModels.description: Price rules are a set of conditions, including entitlements and prerequisites, that must be met in order for a discount code to apply.

allModels.name: price_rule_greater_than_range
allModels.description: Represents either a greater than or greater than or equal to condition, where the latter takes precedence over the former.

allModels.name: price_rule_less_than_range
allModels.description: Represents either a less than or less than or equal to condition, where the latter takes precedence over the former. If less_than_or_equal_to == 100 (or null), and less_than == 20, Shopify combines them into less_than_or_equal_to == 20.

fields.description: Optional list of metafields that can be returned from products/updated webhooks

fields.name: number
fields.description: Numerical identifier for an order unique to the shop. A number is usually sequential and starts at 1.

fields.name: order_number
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier for the order. This one is used by the shop owner and customer. This is different from the id property, which is also a unique numeric identifier for the order, but used for API purposes.

fields.name: payment_gateway_names
fields.description: The list of all payment gateways used for the order.

fields.name: processed_at
fields.description: The date and time when the order was imported.

fields.name: processing_method
fields.description: States the type of payment processing method.

fields.name: referring_site
fields.description: The website that the customer clicked on to come to the shop.

fields.name: refunds
fields.description: The list of refunds applied to the order.

fields.name: shipping_address
fields.description: The mailing address to where the order will be shipped.

fields.name: shipping_lines
fields.description: An array of shipping_line objects, each of which details the shipping methods used.

fields.name: source_name
fields.description: Where the order originated. May only be set during creation, and is not writeable thereafter.

fields.name: subtotal_price
fields.description: Price of the order before shipping and taxes.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Tags are additional short descriptors, commonly used for filtering and searching, formatted as a string of comma-separated values.

fields.name: tax_lines
fields.description: An array of tax_line objects, each of which details the total taxes applicable to the order.

fields.name: taxes_included
fields.description: States whether or not taxes are included in the order subtotal.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Unique identifier for a particular order.

fields.name: total_discounts
fields.description: The total amount of the discounts to be applied to the price of the order.

fields.name: total_line_items_price
fields.description: The sum of all the prices of all the items in the order.

fields.name: total_price
fields.description: The sum of all the prices of all the items in the order, taxes and discounts included (must be positive).

fields.name: total_tax
fields.description: The sum of all the taxes applied to the order (must be positive).

fields.name: total_weight
fields.description: The sum of all the weights of the line items in the order, in grams.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The date and time when the order was last modified.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Only present on orders processed at point of sale. The unique numerical identifier for the user logged into the terminal at the time the order was processed at.

fields.name: order_status_url
fields.description: The URL pointing to the order status web page. The URL will be null unless the order was created from a checkout.

fields.name: inventory_behaviour
fields.description: Determines which inventory updating behaviour is used.

fields.name: gateway
fields.description: The payment gateway used.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: The list of transactions to be created for the order.  Recommendation is to create transactions through the Transactions API, but a use case to create inline transactions may be for gift card payment transactions which are available at order creation.

fields.name: send_receipt
fields.description: Determines whether an order confirmation will be sent to the customer.

fields.name: metafields
fields.description: Metafields associated to the order

fields.name: email
fields.description: The customer's email address.

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: The customer's first name.

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: The customer's last name.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: Optional phone number for the customer.

fields.name: order
fields.description: Shopify order

fields.name: avs_result_code
fields.description: The Response code from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Address_Verification_System.  The code is a single letter; see http://www.emsecommerce.net/avs_cvv2_response_codes.htm for the codes and their definitions.

fields.name: credit_card_bin
fields.description: The issuer identification number (IIN), formerly known as bank identification number (BIN) ] of the customer's credit card. This is made up of the first few digits of the credit card number.

fields.name: credit_card_company
fields.description: The name of the company who issued the customer's credit card.

fields.name: credit_card_number
fields.description: The customer's credit card number, with most of the leading digits redacted with Xs.

fields.name: cvv_result_code
fields.description: The Response code from the credit card company indicating whether the customer entered the card security code, a.k.a. card verification value, correctly. The code is a single letter or empty string

fields.description: The total amount of VAT applied. VAT is applied to the item price and optionally to the duty/shipping prices based on the destination country.

types.description: Represents items that can be delivered electronically (e.g. a gift card delivered via email)
Represents items that are physical and require shipment

allUnions.description: A delivery represents a group of items that will be delivered together - presenting a single price and delivery time frame, where applicable, to the user. Deliveries commonly are created based on the type of item and, for physical goods, their center of origin

allUnions.name: tier_rule_outcome

types.description: Add a certain amount on the actual base cost
Add a certain percentage of the actual base cost

allUnions.description: Possible outcome types from a tier rule

values.name: console
values.description: Defines the Flow Console application

values.name: none
values.description: In no scenario should a customer pay tax within the Flow system.

values.name: all
values.description: In all scenarios a customer should pay tax within the Flow system.

values.name: invalid_order_number
values.description: Indicates the specified order does not exist

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Indicates that the specified currency code is not valid

values.name: invalid_description
values.description: Indicates that the description is invalid (must be non-empty)

values.name: duplicate
values.description: Indicates that a credit payment with the specified key already exists

values.name: amount_must_be_positive
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount was <= 0

values.name: amount_exceeds_balance
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the remaining balance on the order

values.name: insufficient_amount
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the maximum amount of applicable credit

values.name: all
values.description: Displays all available options to the customer.

values.name: single
values.description: Displays a single option (either DDU or DDP), while the other can be displayed by changing duties and tax preferences at checkout.

values.name: display
values.description: A displayed payment method will be highlighted during the checkout process for an experience.

values.name: archiving
values.description: Archiving indicates an experience has been archived. We allow some time for sessions to expire before fully marking the experience archived.

values.name: invalid_authorization
values.description: Indicates the specified authorization key does not exist

values.name: invalid_authorization_amount
values.description: Indicates the specified authorization amount does not match the first installment in the plan

values.name: invalid_installment_plan
values.description: Indicates the specified installment plan does not exist

values.name: order_item_not_available
values.description: When creating an order, if a particular item is not available in the country / destination (either because it was restricted or excluded from that country), we return this error code and list the specific item numbers which are not available in the 'numbers' field.

values.name: order_identifier_error
values.description: Indicates that there is no order with the specified number (nor an order for which an order identifier with that number has been created)

values.name: authorization_invalid
values.description: The authorization key specified is invalid - either because it does not exist or is not associated with this order

values.name: domestic_shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country for one of your domicile countries and you have asked Flow not to accept orders for this country.

values.name: shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country to which you have asked Flow not to ship.

values.name: value_threshold_exceeded
values.description: Indicates the order value exceeds the value threshold for destination and cannot be shipped. When specified, the order will also populate the threshold attribute.

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Indicates that the specified currency code is not valid

values.name: invalid_country
values.description: Indicates that the specified country code is not valid

values.name: invalid_region
values.description: Indicates that the specified region code is not valid

values.name: invalid_language
values.description: Indicates that the specified language code is not valid

allEnums.name: order_payment_type

values.name: card
values.description: Represents a payment in the form of a credit or debit card

values.name: online
values.description: Represents an online payment (e.g. paypal, alipay, etc)

values.name: credit
values.description: A payment in the form of a credit of some type (e.g. a store credit, gift card) applied to an order

values.name: installment_plan
values.description: An installment plan payment represents that the user has elected an installment plan to pay for this order. For the purposes of the order, the balance will reflect fully paid for the total value of the installment plan, even though individual installments may be created in the future.

values.name: cash_on_delivery
values.description: Request to pay the balance with cash on delivery. Offered only when the final mile carriers support cash on delivery.

allEnums.description: The order payment type identified the different ways a consumer may have paid for an order. The primary purpose is in displaying summary level payment information to the user; the type can then be used to know how to request additional details for each payment.

values.name: adjustment
values.description: A general purpose adjustment applied to the order.

values.name: vat_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment based on whether the VAT de minimis applies to the order.

values.name: duty_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment based on whether the duty de minimis applies to the order.

values.name: duties_item_price
values.description: The duty owed on the price of the order's items, including any added margins and rounding.

values.name: duties_freight
values.description: The duty owed on the freight cost of the order.

values.name: duties_insurance
values.description: The duty owed on the insurance cost of the order.

values.name: vat_item_price
values.description: The VAT owed on the price of the order's items, including any added margins and rounding.

values.name: vat_freight
values.description: The VAT owed on the freight cost of the order.

values.name: vat_insurance
values.description: The VAT owed on the insurance cost of the order.

values.name: vat_duties_item_price
values.description: The VAT owed on the duties on the price of the order's items, including any added margins and rounding.

values.name: vat_duties_freight
values.description: The VAT owed on the duties on the freight cost of the order.

values.name: vat_duties_insurance
values.description: The VAT owed on the duties on the insurance cost of the order.

values.name: item_price
values.description: The sum of the price of the order's items with their currency margins, percent margins, and fixed margins included.

values.name: item_discount
values.description: The sum of all discounts applied to the order's items.

values.name: rounding
values.description: The sum of any rounding applied to the order's items.

values.name: insurance
values.description: The insurance cost for the order.

values.name: shipping
values.description: The shipping cost for the order.

values.name: order_discount
values.description: A discount applied to the entire order.

values.name: subtotal_percent_sales_margin
values.description: The sum of adjustments to item price, margin and rounding made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: subtotal_vat_percent_sales_margin
values.description: The sum of adjustments to VAT owed made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: subtotal_duty_percent_sales_margin
values.description: The sum of adjustments to duty owed made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: vat_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any VAT subsidized by the organization. For example, if VAT is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific VAT rate), the difference will be represented here.

values.name: duty_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any duty subsidized by the organization. For example, if duty is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific duty rate), the difference will be represented here.

values.name: remote_area_surcharge
values.description: Surcharge applied to a shipment for delivery to a remote area determined by the carrier.

values.name: fuel_surcharge
values.description: Surcharge applied to a shipment for fuel consumption by the carrier.

values.name: adjustment
values.description: The details of any adjustments made to the order.

values.name: subtotal
values.description: The details of the subtotal for the order, including item prices, margins, and rounding.

values.name: vat
values.description: The details of any VAT owed on the order.

values.name: duty
values.description: The details of any duties owed on the order.

values.name: shipping
values.description: The details of shipping costs for the order.

values.name: insurance
values.description: The details of insurance costs for the order.

values.name: discount
values.description: The details of any discount applied to the order.

values.name: surcharges
values.description: Additional fees and levies applied to the order

values.name: deny

values.name: order_subtotal
values.description: Order subtotal sets a minimum value - orders whose subtotal is greater than the minimum will have the promotion applied. A common use case is to offer free shipping to orders about 150 CAD.

allEnums.description: The Promotion Trigger Type defines the conditions we evaluate when deciding if a particular promotion should be applied to an order.

values.name: offline

allEnums.description: The payment method type defines at a high level different user experiences that are required to accept payment of this type. allEnums.name: margin_type

values.name: fixed
values.description: A fixed amount to add, e.g 2.5 would add an absolute margin of 2.5 in the base currency of your item.

values.name: percent
values.description: A percent of the base cost to add, e.g. 1.2 would represent a 1.2% increase.

allEnums.description: Either a fixed or percent adjustment applied to some amount.

allEnums.name: merchant_of_record
allEnums.description: The merchant of record enum defines who is merchant of record for a particular transaction - either Flow is serving as the merchant of record or the organization is serving as merchant of record.

allEnums.name: order_merchant_of_record
allEnums.description: The order merchant of record defines who is merchant of record for a particular order. The value will be 'mixed' if you support split payments and the merchant of record differed across the individual payment transactions.

values.name: down

values.name: nearest
values.description: Round to the nearest specified rounding.value. If equidistant, will round up.

allEnums.description: Direction to round localized price

allEnums.name: rounding_type

values.name: pattern
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount ending with a pattern, e.g. an amount ending in '.99'.

values.name: multiple
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount that is the multiple of a value, e.g. rounding to the nearest 5 would ensure that the resulting number ends in either 0 or 5.

allEnums.description: Rounding type determines the rule used to enforce rounding. Common rules will ensure that the final price ends w/ a given number (e.g. ends with .95) or is a multiple of some number (multiples of 5 or 10 are common).

values.description: Payment method has expired

values.name: invalid_name

values.description: Invalid payment number

values.name: invalid_expiration
values.description: Invalid expiration date

values.name: invalid_address
values.description: Invalid billing address

values.name: invalid_token_type
values.description: Cannot create a permanent card via an unauthorized request

values.name: invalid_token
values.description: The provided card token is invalid or it does not exist.

values.description: The provided payment method is not known by the issuing bank (the account does not exist)

values.name: avs
values.description: Declined due to avs mismatch)

values.name: cvv
values.description: Declined due to cvv mismatch)

values.description: Declined due to suspected fraud

values.description: Declined due to suspected duplicate transaction

allEnums.name: authorization_option

values.name: store_card
values.description: If set, and the authorization is created using a one time nonce, we automatically tokenize and store the card. In these cases you will want to store the new card token in the authorization response (card object)

allEnums.description: Specifies optional behaviors that can be applied during an authorization

allEnums.name: authorization_result_action_type

values.name: redirect
values.description: Indicates that the user should be redirected to the provided URL.

values.name: wait
values.description: Indicates that more time is needed before the authorization result is known. In the case of 3D Secure, this means the authorization status should be polled until it is no longer pending.

allEnums.description: Specifies an action necessary to continue processing the authorization, such as redirecting to a payment issuer to complete user verification.

values.name: pending
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'pending'. For example, online payment methods like AliPay or PayPal will have a status of 'pending' until the user completes the payment. Pending authorizations expire if the user does not complete the payment in a timely fashion.

values.name: expired
values.description: Authorization has expired.

values.name: authorized
values.description: Authorization was successful

values.name: review
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'review' - this usually indicates fraud review requires additional time / verification (or a potential network issue with the issuing bank)

values.name: declined
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been declined by the issuing bank. See the authorization decline code for more details as to the reason for decline.

values.name: reversed
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been fully reversed. You can fully reverse an authorization up until the moment you capture funds; once you have captured funds you must create refunds.

values.name: match
values.description: Full match

values.name: partial
values.description: Partial match; see details in 'avs' model to understand which components matched

values.name: unsupported
values.description: Issuer does not support address verification

values.name: no_match
values.description: Address does not match expected card values

allEnums.name: refund_decline_code

values.description: All associated payment captures have expired; refunds can no longer be issued

values.name: insufficient_funds
values.description: The requested refund amount exceeded the amount of remaining unrefunded funds

values.name: unknown
values.description: Failed due to another reason (details not known)

allEnums.description: Contains details related to the reason for which a refund failed.

values.name: pending
values.description: The refund has been initiated and requires time to complete.

values.name: succeeded
values.description: The refund has been processed successfully.

values.name: failed
values.description: The refund failed to process.

values.name: canceled
values.description: The refund was canceled.

values.name: amount_exceeds_balance
values.description: Amount specified exceeds the remaining authorization balance.

values.name: authorization_declined
values.description: The authorization was initially declined; there is nothing to reverse.

values.name: authorization_expired
values.description: The authorization has expired and can no longer be reversed.

values.name: invalid_authorization
values.description: The authorization was not found.

values.name: invalid_key
values.description: Invalid key

values.name: invalid_amount
values.description: Amount is not valid - usually because amount was <= 0

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Currency is either not known or invalid

values.name: no_remaining_balance
values.description: The authorization has already been fully captured and/or reversed - there are no additional funds to reverse.

values.name: partial_reversal_not_supported
values.description: Indicates a request for a partial reversal when the underlying processor does not support it

values.name: unknown
values.description: Unknown or other

values.name: pending
values.description: Reversal is pending processing.

values.name: processed
values.description: Reversal has been processed successfully.

values.name: failed
values.description: Reversal failed to process.

values.name: permanent
values.description: Create a permanent token for the card (stored up until normal purge interval)

values.name: one_time
values.description: Create a one time token for the card. This token can be used to either authorized payment or later exchange for a permanent token. Once used, this token cannot be used for future activity.

values.name: generic_error
values.description: Generic errors are the default type. The accompanying message will provide details on the failure.

values.name: client_error
values.description: A client error has occurred. This represents a misconfiguration of the client

values.name: server_error
values.description: A server error has occurred. The Flow tech team is automatically notified of all server errors

values.name: customer
values.description: The customer changed or cancelled the order.

values.name: fraud
values.description: The order was fraudulent.

values.name: inventory
values.description: Items in the order were not in inventory.

values.name: declined
values.description: The payment was declined.

values.name: other
values.description: The order was cancelled for a reason not in the list above.

values.name: fixed_amount
values.description: Applies a discount of amount as a unit of the store's currency.

values.name: percentage
values.description: Applies a percentage discount of amount.

values.name: shipping
values.description: Applies a free shipping discount on orders that have a shipping rate less than or equal to amount.

allEnums.name: localized_price
allEnums.description: Localized price types

allEnums.name: price_rule_allocation_method
allEnums.description: The allocation method of the price rule. With an allocation method of each, the discount will be applied to each of the entitled items. For example, for a price rule that take $15 off, each entitled line item in a checkout will be discounted by $15. With an allocation method of across, the calculated discount amount will be applied across the entitled items. For example, for a price rule that takes $15 off, the discount will be applied across all the entitled items. Currently, if target_type is shipping_line, then only each is accepted.

allEnums.name: price_rule_customer_selection
allEnums.description: The customer selection for the price rule. A customer selection of all means there are no restrictions on who's eligible for the price rule. A customer selection of prerequisite means a customer needs to belong to one of the specified prerequisite customer saved searches in prerequisite_saved_search_ids.

allEnums.name: price_rule_target_selection
allEnums.description: The target selection method of the price rule. Use all to apply the discount to all line items in the checkout and use entitled to apply to selected entitlements.

allEnums.name: price_rule_target_type
allEnums.description: The target type the price rule applies to.

allEnums.name: price_rule_value_type
allEnums.description: The value type of the price rule. If target_type is shipping_line then only percentage is accepted.

While in most common cases, we expect users to have email addresses, there are edge cases where it is useful to allow a user to NOT have an email address. allEnums.name: rounding_type

values.name: pattern
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount ending with a pattern, e.g. an amount ending in '.99'.

values.name: multiple
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount that is the multiple of a value, e.g. rounding to the nearest 5 would ensure that the resulting number ends in either 0 or 5.

allEnums.description: Rounding type determines the rule used to enforce rounding. Common rules will ensure that the final price ends w/ a given number (e.g. ends with .95) or is a multiple of some number (multiples of 5 or 10 are common).
